tournament.name: Week of Wings Entry Event Friday Flight 1

decks.notes: This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Dream Trawler to maintain control of the board through counterspells and removal. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sun while drawing into powerful late-game plays like Emeria's Call. Elspeth Conquers Death and Skyclave Apparition provide additional removal options, while Yorion's ability to blink permanents adds value to the deck. The deck's mana base is designed to support its control elements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively dominate the battlefield with a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to deal damage early and efficiently with creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Nighthawk Scavenger, while also utilizing removal spells such as Heartless Act and Bloodchief's Thirst to control the opponent's board. The deck benefits from graveyard synergies with cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Tymaret Calls the Dead, and has some additional value with cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Liliana, Waker of the Dead.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to control the board through a mix of creature removal, counter spells, and card advantage engines like Into the Story. Utilizing cards like Ruin Crab and Lullmage's Domination, the deck also aims to mill the opponent's deck to limit their resources. With options for disruption, card advantage, and graveyard recursion, this deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent in a long game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw. By utilizing Yorion as a companion, the player aims to maximize the value of their enter-the-battlefield effects. This deck aims to stall the game with cards like Dream Trawler and Shatter the Sky, while generating card advantage with Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. With a strong mana base and a mix of interactive spells, the deck seeks to outlast opponents and secure victory through powerful late-game threats like Elspeth Conquers Death and Emeria's Call.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through removal spells, card draw, and enchantments. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Shatter the Sky and Doom Foretold, while generating card advantage with Teferi's Tutelage and Dance of the Manse. The win condition comes from playing powerful threats like Dream Trawler and utilizing the graveyard with cards like Erebos's Intervention. The deck also includes a mix of lands and artifacts for consistency and resilience.

This mono green aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and playing powerful creature threats to overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Garruk, Unleashed and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate providing additional value and card advantage, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and close out the game with big threats like Feasting Troll King and Questing Beast. The deck also includes removal options like Primal Might and Trail of Crumbs to deal with opposing threats, while utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Wolfwillow Haven and Gilded Goose to ensure a fast and aggressive start.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle using a combination of strong creatures and removal spells. The key concept centers around quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of early game pressure and disruption. The deck utilizes powerful creatures such as Rankle, Master of Pranks, Nighthawk Scavenger, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, accompanied by efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant, Murderous Rider, and Heartless Act. Additional support comes from spells like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Liliana, Waker of the Dead, creating a strong, disruptive, and aggressive game plan.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures and powerful pump spells to quickly deal damage and overwhelm them before they have a chance to stabilize. Key cards such as Embercleave and Anax, Hardened in the Forge provide additional damage and board presence, while cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell enhance the damage output of red creatures. The mana base is heavily focused on Mountains to ensure consistent red mana for casting spells and creatures.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with a mix of counterspells and removal spells while also utilizing powerful creature abilities to apply pressure. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief help mill the opponent's deck while also growing in power. Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recurring threats or removal spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board and finish off the opponent quickly with evasive threats like Zareth San, the Trickster. Efficient card draw and land options help maintain tempo and consistency.

This deck focuses on using evasive creatures like Nighthawk Scavenger and Brazen Borrower to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It also includes disruptive elements like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Drown in the Loch to control the opponent's board and graveyard, while providing card advantage with Into the Story. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick and decisive victory through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast, while utilizing powerful combat tricks and removal spells to clear the way for attacks. Embercleave serves as a finisher to deal massive damage to the opponent out of nowhere. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana and the deck aims to win the game through aggressive creature attacks and combat tricks.

The main idea of this Rakdos Control deck is to use a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard recursion to control the game and out-value the opponent. By using cards like Duress, Heartless Act, and Bonecrusher Giant to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage through cards like Liliana, Waker of the Dead and Tymaret Calls the Dead, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and take over the game with its powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Ox of Agonas.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful damage-dealing spells. By consistently applying pressure and utilizing cards that benefit from a fast pace of play, such as Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, the goal is to swiftly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize. This deck focuses on efficient creatures and burn spells, along with the use of Castle Embereth to buff creatures and close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Genesis Ultimatum to maintain board advantage and remove threats. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra to cast big spells like Sea Gate Restoration and Shatterskull Smashing. Additionally, the deck includes creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Terror of the Peaks to pressure the opponent and provide additional win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a game of attrition.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt your opponent's plans while building up resources. Mazemind Tome and Frantic Inventory provide card advantage, while cards like Rewind and Shark Typhoon help stall the game and create threats. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, while countering key spells with Essence Scatter and Mystical Dispute. The end game is to close out the match with powerful finishers like Crawling Barrens and Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. The key strategy involves utilizing Transmogrify to cheat out powerful threats like Dream Trawler, Yorion, and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to control the board and eventually close out the game. The deck also includes card draw and token generation to maintain card advantage and create blockers. Additionally, the mana base is optimized for consistent color access and flexibility.
